Counting and Cardinality: Count to 100 by ones and tens.
Understand the relationship between numbers and quantities.
Compare numbers (greater than, less than, equal to).
Operations and Algebraic Thinking: Understand addition as putting together and subtraction as taking apart.
Solve addition and subtraction word problems with small numbers.
Number and Operations in Base Ten: Work with numbers 11–19 to understand place value (10 ones and some more).
Geometry: Identify and describe shapes (squares, circles, triangles, etc.).
Measurement and Data: Compare objects by measurable attributes like length or weight.

Operations and Algebraic Thinking: Solve addition and subtraction problems within 20.
Understand the properties of operations (commutative, associative).
Number and Operations in Base Ten: Use place value understanding to add and subtract.
Geometry: Reason about shapes and their attributes.
Measurement and Data: Tell and write time to the hour and half-hour.

Operations and Algebraic Thinking: Solve problems involving addition and subtraction within 100.
Understand equal groups as foundations for multiplication.
Measurement and Data: Measure and estimate lengths in standard units.

Operations and Algebraic Thinking: Develop fluency in multiplication and division within 100.
Solve problems involving the four operations.
Number and Operations\u2014Fractions: Represent fractions on a number line.
Number and Operations in Base Ten: Use place value to round whole numbers.
Geometry: Reason with shapes and their attributes.
Understand area as an attribute of plane figures.
Measurement and Data: Solve problems involving time, measurement, and data interpretation.

Operations and Algebraic Thinking: Solve multi-step word problems with whole numbers.
Number and Operations in Base Ten: Generalize place value understanding for multi-digit numbers.
Use place value strategies to perform multi-digit arithmetic.
Number and Operations\u2014Fractions: Add and subtract fractions with like denominators.
Measurement and Data: Solve problems involving measurement and conversions within a system.
Geometry: Draw and identify lines and angles.
Classify shapes by properties of their lines and angles.

Number and Operations in Base Ten: Perform operations with multi-digit whole numbers and decimals.
Number and Operations\u2014Fractions: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators.
Multiply and divide fractions and decimals.
Measurement and Data: Convert like measurement units within a system.
Understand concepts of volume and relate volume to multiplication and addition.
Geometry: Graph points on the coordinate plane.
Classify two-dimensional figures based on their properties.

Ratios and Proportional Relationships: Understand ratio concepts and use ratio reasoning to solve problems.
The Number System: Apply operations with fractions to divide fractions by fractions.
Extend number line understanding to include negative numbers.
Expressions and Equations: Write and evaluate numerical expressions with exponents.
Geometry: Solve real-world problems involving area, surface area, and volume.
Statistics and Probability: Develop an understanding of statistical variability.

Ratios and Proportional Relationships: Analyze proportional relationships and use them to solve real-world problems.
The Number System: Apply operations with rational numbers (including negatives).
Expressions and Equations: Solve problems using numerical and algebraic expressions and equations.
Work with two-step equations and inequalities.
Geometry: Solve problems involving scale drawings and informal geometric constructions.
Understand and apply the properties of angles, triangles, and circles.
Statistics and Probability: Investigate chance processes and evaluate probabilities.
Compare two populations using measures of center and variability.
